name: dependency-check-build-task
description: Dependency Check is a Software Composition Analysis (SCA) tool that attempts to detect publicly disclosed vulnerabilities contained within a project's dependencies.
author: Dependency Check

inputs.name: projectName
inputs.label: Project Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the project being scanned.

inputs.name: scanPath
inputs.label: Scan Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to scan. Supports Ant style paths (e.g. 'directory/**/*.jar').

inputs.name: excludePath
inputs.label: Exclude Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path patterns to exclude from the scan. Supports Ant style path patterns (e.g. /exclude/).

inputs.name: format
inputs.label: Report Format
inputs.helpMarkDown: The output format to write to (XML, HTML, CSV, JSON, JUNIT, SARIF, ALL). Multiple formats can be selected. The default is HTML.

inputs.name: failOnCVSS
inputs.label: CVSS Failure Threshold
inputs.helpMarkDown: Threshold between 0 and 10 that will cause Dependency Check will return the exit code if a vulnerability with a CVSS score equal to or higher was identified.

inputs.name: suppressionPath
inputs.label: Suppression Paths
inputs.helpMarkDown: The file path to the suppression XML file used to suppress false positives. This can be specified more than once to utilize multiple suppression files. The argument can be a local file path, a URL to a suppression file, or even a reference to a file on the class path.

inputs.name: reportsDirectory
inputs.label: Report Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Report output directory. On-prem build agents can specify a local directory to override the default location. The default location is the $COMMON_TESTRESULTSDIRECTORY\dependency-check directory.

inputs.name: reportFilename
inputs.label: Report Filename
inputs.helpMarkDown: Report output filename. Will set the report output name in 'reportsDirectory' to specified filename. Will not work if format is ALL, or multiple formats are supplied to the 'format' parameter. Filename must have an extension or dependency-check will assume it is a path.

inputs.name: warnOnCVSSViolation
inputs.label: Only warn for found violations
inputs.helpMarkDown: Will only warn for found violations above the CVSS failure threshold instead of throwing an error. This build step will then succeed with issues instead of failing.

inputs.name: additionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Pass additional command line arguments to the Dependency Check command line interface.

inputs.name: localInstallPath
inputs.label: Local Install Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The local path to the `dependency-check` installation directory (on-prem build agents only). Setting this field will run Dependency Check locally instead of downloading the installer onto the build agent.

inputs.name: customRepo
inputs.label: Custom Installer Repository URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: By default, the build task downloads the installer from the Dependency Check GitHub releases. Entering a value for this field will pull the installer package from a custom endpoint.

inputs.name: dependencyCheckVersion
inputs.label: Installer Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: By default, the build task downloads the latest installer from the Dependency Check GitHub releases. Setting this field will change the Dependency Check version downloaded onto the build agent.

inputs.name: dataMirror
inputs.label: Data Mirror Archive URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: The https path to the compressed Dependency Check data directory (containing the odc.mv.db and jsrepository.json files).
